string-array.name: addition_explanations

When you combine a group of %1$d with a group of %2$d, the new, bigger group has %3$d things in it.

A bus has %1$d people on it. At the next stop, %2$d more people get on. The bus is now carrying %3$d people.

Think of it as climbing a ladder. You climb %1$d steps, take a break, and then climb %2$d more. You\'ve climbed %3$d steps!
A cat has %1$d toys and its owner buys %2$d new ones. The lucky cat now has %3$d toys to play with.

Combining %1$d and %2$d is like merging two small streams into a big river. The result is a mighty %3$d!

string-array.name: subtraction_explanations
string-array.item: Subtracting %2$d from %1$d means you start with %1$d items and take %2$d away. You are left with %3$d.
If you have %1$d cookies and eat %2$d of them, you will have %3$d cookies left. Yum!
On a number line, if you start at %1$d and move back %2$d spaces, you will land on %3$d.
The difference between %1$d and %2$d is %3$d. It\'s what\'s left when you take the smaller number from the bigger one.
Taking away %2$d from %1$d leaves you with %3$d. It\'s like reverse adding!
A superhero fought %1$d villains and defeated %2$d of them. There are %3$d villains left to catch!
You have %1$d balloons, but %2$d of them pop! Oh no! You now have %3$d balloons.
A tree had %1$d apples. If %2$d apples fall to the ground, there are still %3$d apples on the tree.
You start with %1$d pieces of candy and share %2$d with your friends. You get to keep %3$d pieces for yourself.
A spaceship is on a %1$d-day mission. If %2$d days have already passed, there are %3$d days left in the mission.
If a book has %1$d pages and you have already read %2$d of them, you only have %3$d pages left to read.
You have %1$d dollars and you spend %2$d on a toy. You will have %3$d dollars remaining.
A tower made of %1$d blocks has %2$d blocks knocked off the top. The tower is now %3$d blocks high.
There are %1$d birds sitting on a wire. If %2$d of them fly away, %3$d birds are left.
What number do you need to add to %2$d to get to %1$d? That number is %3$d!
Imagine a race that is %1$d miles long. If you have already run %2$d miles, you have %3$d miles to go.
A full glass has %1$d ounces of juice. After you drink %2$d ounces, there are %3$d ounces left.
If you need to find %1$d hidden treasures and you\'ve already found %2$d, there are %3$d still waiting to be discovered.
A group of %1$d penguins is on an iceberg. If %2$d of them jump into the water, %3$d penguins remain on the ice.
Subtraction is finding out how much is left. When %2$d is taken from %1$d, the amount left is %3$d.

string-array.name: multiplication_explanations
string-array.item: Multiplying %1$d by %2$d is like adding %1$d to itself %2$d times. That gives you a total of %3$d.
Imagine you have %2$d bags, and each bag has %1$d marbles. In total, you have %3$d marbles!
This is asking for %2$d groups of %1$d. If you count all the items in all the groups, you get %3$d.
Multiplication is a fast way to add. %1$d times %2$d is the same as %1$d + %1$d… (%2$d times), which equals %3$d.
When you see %1$d × %2$d, it means you have %1$d repeated %2$d times. The result is a big %3$d!
If a superhero can lift %1$d cars, and there are %2$d superheroes, together they can lift %3$d cars! Wow!
In a garden, there are %2$d rows of flowers, with %1$d flowers in each row. That makes a beautiful garden of %3$d flowers.
If you get %1$d stickers on a page, and you have %2$d pages, you have a giant collection of %3$d stickers.
A box of crayons has %1$d colors. If you have %2$d boxes, you have %3$d crayons to draw with.
An octopus has 8 arms. If there were %1$d octopuses (and each had %2$d arms), they would have %3$d arms all together!
If a car has %1$d wheels, then %2$d cars would have a total of %3$d wheels rolling down the street.
You are building with blocks. You make %2$d towers, and each tower is %1$d blocks high. You used %3$d blocks in total.
A cookie recipe makes %1$d cookies per batch. If you make %2$d batches, you will have %3$d cookies to share.
If a video game level gives you %1$d points, and you beat %2$d levels, you will earn %3$d points.
Think of a grid. A grid with %1$d rows and %2$d columns has a total of %3$d squares inside it.
If a book costs %1$d dollars, and you want to buy %2$d of them for your friends, you will need %3$d dollars.
A spider has 8 legs. If you saw %1$d spiders (and each had %2$d legs), you would see %3$d legs crawling around!
Each pack of juice has %1$d cartons. If you buy %2$d packs, you will have %3$d juice cartons.
If you save %1$d dollars every week for %2$d weeks, you will have saved up %3$d dollars.
Multiplication helps you count big groups quickly. %2$d groups of %1$d is always %3$d.

string-array.name: division_explanations
string-array.item: Dividing %1$d by %2$d means you are splitting %1$d into %2$d equal groups. Each group will have %3$d items.
If you have %1$d stickers to share equally among %2$d friends, each friend gets %3$d stickers.
Division asks, "How many times does %2$d fit into %1$d?" The answer is exactly %3$d times!
Think of it like this: %2$d times what number equals %1$d? That missing number is %3$d. That\'s division!
When you break down %1$d into %2$d smaller, even parts, each part is %3$d. Well done!
A superhero has %1$d gadgets and wants to put them into %2$d utility belts, with the same number in each. Each belt will hold %3$d gadgets.
You baked %1$d cookies and want to put them into bags with %2$d cookies each. You can make %3$d bags.
A pizza is cut into %1$d slices. If %2$d people are sharing it equally, each person gets to eat %3$d slices.
A team of %1$d players needs to be split into %2$d smaller teams. Each smaller team will have %3$d players.
If you have a rope that is %1$d feet long and you cut it into %2$d equal pieces, each piece will be %3$d feet long.
Dealing cards! If you have %1$d cards and %2$d players, you can deal each player %3$d cards.
A book has %1$d pages. If you want to read it in %2$d days, reading the same amount each day, you should read %3$d pages per day.
You have %1$d toys to put away on %2$d shelves. To be fair, you should put %3$d toys on each shelf.
A total of %1$d dollars was found and is being shared by %2$d people. Each person gets a fair share of %3$d dollars.
Division is like fair sharing. When you share %1$d among %2$d, everybody gets %3$d.
How many groups of %2$d can you make from %1$d? You can make exactly %3$d groups.
A car trip is %1$d miles long. If you want to finish it in %2$d hours, you need to travel %3$d miles each hour.
You have %1$d building blocks and want to make towers that are %2$d blocks tall. You can build %3$d towers.
A farmer collected %1$d eggs and puts them into cartons that hold %2$d eggs each. The farmer can fill %3$d cartons.
Division is the opposite of multiplication. Since %2$d × %3$d = %1$d, we know that %1$d ÷ %2$d = %3$d.
